sub_title: Head of Product Operations at Miro | EMBA
summary:
I have 17+ years of experience in building processes and bringing structure to increase the efficiency of product development organizations. And I have a lot of passion for it! 
I successfully managed complex change during scale-ups and business transformations. And I can do it very quickly and effectively!
I always retain and grow the talent inside the organization during times of uncertainty and know how to make people loyal. 
I believe that people's engagement is the key to the success of any organization.

school.name: Belarusian State University of Informatics and Radioelectronics

courses.name: Swedish Institute Management Programme NE on Corporate Social Responsibility and Sustainability, 2017
Various Management Courses by IPM Business School

profile_positions.description:
Report to CPO
- Built product operations function in Miro from scratch, hired a team of ops managers, and set them up for success 
- Quickly and successfully transform processes in product development organization to ensure continuous and predictable customer value delivery during and after scale-up of from 350+ to 800+ people 

Some of the achievements:
- Designed, described, and implemented Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC) framework for Miro
- Set up OKR process and operations (meetings, rituals, tools, communication channels, etc) in every stream 
- Created Product Roadmap and continuous process around roadmapping so that the company knows what each team plans to deliver within the upcoming 6 months and GTM teams are trained to transparently talk with enterprise customers
- Increased predictability of product roadmap delivery from 35% to 80% (within 6 months)
- Implemented transparent delivery status reporting at all levels to inform stakeholders' decision-making
- Created data collection and analyses process for the key senior stakeholders to inform their decision-making
- Implemented Jira for the entire product development lifecycle (well-balanced standardization vs freedom for the teams to define their own ways of working) 
- Implemented Product Review framework and the process that ensures organizational alignment around Product Portfolio investments
- Defined attributes and product metrics required to plan and measure success for every product initiative at 0-1,1-10,10-100 stages of product development
- Organized customer feedback into one system that enables CSM teams to close the loop with customers and product teams to take the most important requests into the roadmap 
- Implemented beta testing process
- Implemented the process to ensure compliance of the product with non-functional requirements
- Created the content and implemented the onboarding process for product managers and designers
- Implemented many strategic initiatives for the CPO
profile_positions.title: Head of Product Operations

profile_positions.description: Consulted several startups at series B (50-150 ppl) to help them scale up product development to bring it to the next maturity level
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Project-based role on the mandate of the owner and the CEO (reported to the CEO).

I was responsible for the transformation of product development in the company (45+ employees). 
Goals and achievements:
- Proposed and implemented org structure so that it fits the business needs of the company while using talents inside the company. Put the right people into the right places to help them maximize their performance,  
- Fixed delivery processes, formally described many of them, organized the teams to focus on predictability and quality of their work: implemented transparent technical and business roadmaps, set up metrics and KPIs and enabled teams to find the balance between quality and time to market. 
- Transformed Jira workflow that helped find and fix many overheads and bottlenecks, and increased teams' productivity
- Trained newly introduced delivery managers and helped them level up in both people and process management.
- Built and bonded the team of delivery managers
- Build performance review process for the product development organization, made roles description and expectations transparent and clear
- Implemented project management practices
- Fixed  issues and introduced processes to significantly improve communication loops between product development organization and GTM teams
profile_positions.title: Chief Delivery Officer

profile_positions.description:
Reported to CIO.
I was fully responsible for the transformation of the product development organization, and directly managed a team of 70+ people.
Main achievements.
- Built an effective organizational structure of the unit to fit business strategy and goals. 
- Built a strong management team that was capable of effectively facing all types of challenges of that business also after I transitioned myself out of the company. Most of the people were selected from inside the unit and trained to become great managers. They constantly received amazing feedback on their work from their teams, peers, and also from the top management of the company. 
- Build a predictable and efficient product delivery process. 100% of the games were delivered to the customers on time. 
- Improved time-to-market through delivery process transformation (depending on the type of game, by 30% on average)
- Created a motivation system for the employees based on clear and transparent KPIs  
- Implemented performance review process, described roles, responsibilities, and career ladders
- Decreased retention rate to make it the lowest in the company (was the highest before I joint)
profile_positions.title: Head of Product Development Studio

profile_positions.description:
Reported to VP of engineering. 
Built and managed a cross-functional team of 35+ people that developed one of the key products in the Portfolio of Adform - Data Management Platform (DMP).
The key challenge was to retain and re-engage the core team of 8 ppl, and grow it to ensure quick product scale-up from an internal strat-up with validated product-market fit to enterprise-ready software.
Main achievements: 
- No one left the team despite enormous demotivation due to internal conflicts, and the team had the lowest attrition rate in the company ever since
- Fixed complicated relationships between the team and key senior stakeholders 
- Scaled up the team and built delivery processes for it: 85% of features were delivered according to the plan and were enterprise-ready
- Scaled up customer support and QA function to ensure the highest quality standards 
- Built the process to ensure 99,99% uptime 
- Built product management team 
- Built a process to ensure constant improvement in the speed of delivery based on the theory of constraints
- Built performance review process
profile_positions.title: Development Group Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all product and business operations in: 
- ITMINE business school - the most well know courses in business analyses and UX in Belarus
- Reactivebit product development company (30 ppl) that worked for several international clients 
- UXPressia - a strat-up built to help product managers and designers create professional customer journey maps
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
1. Delivery manager for a team of 20 people.
Main achievements.
- Saved and grew by 20% the account for the company by solving the conflict between the “old” team and the “new” VP of engineering hired by the customer, and established successful cooperation between all the parties. 
2. Operations manager on the account of 250+ employees
Main achievements.
- Built delivery processes that enabled to scale of the account by 30% within 1 year.
profile_positions.title: Program / Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Worked as product manager for 2 products: µTorrent client for MAC OS and an in-company start-up. 
Also ran product operations: scaled the cross-functional team (from 2 to 20 ppl) and built and managed product delivery process in Minsk hub.
Main achievements.
- Improved µTorrent for Mac and brought it on top among the competitors by growing active users from 2+ million to 6+ million
- New product was built from the idea to alpha version and product market fit was validated (the product was successful and is still in use)
profile_positions.title: Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Worked as project and QA people manager for all B2C and some B2B products with product development teams from Belarus, the USA, Israel and Sweden. Managed a department of 25 ppl. 

Started as Jr. QA in 2006 and grew into the team lead in 6 months, then was promoted to QA department manager (Group manager) after another 1 year.
profile_positions.title: QA Group Manager
